summary: The Bridge Corrosion Prevention and Repair Act of 2025 aims to address bridge corrosion. It mandates certified contractors for specific bridge projects, focusing on surface preparation, coating application, and hazardous coating removal. It requires a corrosion management system and qualified training programs for workers. It also amends federal funding to include corrosion control on rail bridges and mandates a study on best practices for inspecting and addressing corrosion on weathering steel bridges, with a report to Congress and distribution to relevant entities.
